Reviews.Title: “Good location near the airport - Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there for a business trip. All of the staff was extremely friendly. As it has been said this hotel is 2 years old but still seems new inside. I like the rooms as they are very comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet was very good. The layout is a bit awkward (they didn't design that space very well. Too narrow. But all in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Vav22
Reviews.Content: We were leaving phoenix but ended up missing our flight.. Picked the holiday inn & suites to stay. The front desk were so helpful as we were not prepared for another night. The shuttle is a 5 min drive too

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HowardTucson
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Phoenix for a 2 day meeting and opted for the Holiday Inn & Suites near the airport for my one night stay. This is a relatively new hotel -- opened about 2 years ago, I believe. Check in was easy and the person at the desk was very courteous. The room was clean, and it was spacious. I opted for a king size bed, which left plenty of room to walk around. There was a comfortable chair in the corner for lounging, as well as a desk for work. The room included a small refrigerator (not stocked) and an well appointed bathroom with a large walk in shower. There were two sets of pillows on the bed -- one marked soft and the other marked firm. Unfortunately, neither were to my liking, but I made do with what I had. I had a glass of wine in the bar before calling it a night -- it was a generous glass. The hotel has a small fitness room ( a stationary bike, 2 treadmills and an elliptical), and the fitness room is open 24 hours a day. There is also a business center that has a couple of computers and printers. The restaurant offers a buffet or order off the menu options in the morning. As I was not there for lunch or dinner, I do not know what those menus are like. I opted for the buffet, which had a nice selection of cold and hot foods, including beverages. The price, as I recall, was about $12. The food was good. All in all, this was a good place to stay -- convenient to where my meeting was, and it offers easy access to where ever you may want to go in Phoenix as it is just off University near the 143. I don't know that one room or another matters, but I was in room 204 -- it was certainly quiet. The cost of the room was about $145 with taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: homesafe60
Reviews.Content: The Staff here are top notch right from the friendly efficient front desk people (Andrea and Dan) to the waiters and waitresses. The rooms were very clean and I will always stay here when in Phoenix. Kudos to whoever hired such staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: e-14
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel in March 2012 for baseball spring training. This hotel was awesome! Modern, clean, friendly staff, and great location. If you have a modern GPS system, you will easily find this hotel. Like an earlier review, I never heard any airplane noise from the nearby Phoenix Airport. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “It's really not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: Wickershumskin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the executive suite for 3 nights. The room looked clean and nice. But the a/c made so much noise that I couldn't sleep for the first night. The service was the most aweful part. Firstly, the front desk or the room service rarely picked up calls. I walked up to the front desk only to find that there was nobody there. And they didn't care to have a bell so that I could call someone. I stood there for 10 minutes, but nobody showed up. Secondly, on the second day of my stay I found that my sheets were not changed or there were just stained new sheets. When I called up the front desk, they told me that they'd call back. They did call back - to tell me that the cleaning service people left and they'd change the sheets the next day. And I was leaving the next day. Lastly, the coffee in the room was the worst I have ever had in any hotel in US, period. The coffee in the restaurant was only slightly better. Anyways, if this is the quality of service you get after spending more than 700 bucks for 3 nights, there's seriously something wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Night's Stay”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: They put us in a room on the second floor directly above a live band on the first floor. The band played till 1:00AM...not much sleep that night.

Reviews.Title: “Had to return”
Reviews.Author: Redland
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel many months back and decided to confirm that this is the place to stay when in Phoenix. The front desk person was very helpful when I checked in and the manager happened to come out and was great. Spoke with me about my needs and volunteered his assistance if I needed anything. He reminded me of the restaurant and bar hours and when breakfast was available. We discussed the great food service they have and I mentioned on my last visit that I was disappointed that they had taken the bacon wrapped shrimp off of the menu any he said to let the restaurant know as they were very responsive and would probably consider my request. Nice clean, relatively new hotel, a good value. Good to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms - so-so breakfast”
Reviews.Author: le-metro
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Holiday Inn Express as it was very close to the airport for an early afternoon flight. The room was new, clean and had all the things we needed for the night. The only area of improvement was the breakfast. It was my assumption that breakfast was included (my fault), but were willing to pay for the buffet as a quick start to the day as we were in a bit of a rush to get to the airport. The buffet was around $11 per person, which was a bit pricey for the food provided, but was the quickest option. Many of the items, such as cereal, juice, coffee were fine. As for the eggs, pancakes and other hot items, they seemed to have sat there for awhile and were not refreshed. I asked the waitress if new food would be coming and she stated that it would be out shortly. It took awhile. The new items were only offered as we were ready to leave. My advice would be to order off the menu or view the freshness of the buffet prior to ordering. Overall service from staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: tonycStavanger
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to phoenix airport for one night. We were not arriving until late at night after nearly 24 hours of travelling. Clean, quiet and friendly is all we wanted. We had a short wait at the airport because I was not aware that I had to ring for the shuttle bus to come and pick us up. Very friendly driver and also a very pleasant night porter. However, my pet hate, the room key did not function. Back down to reception and it was sorted quickly. A very nice room and a good night of sleep. Breakfast was good and the waiter was helpful. A short but pleasant stay that I would recommend to anyone who just wants a pleasant, clean, functional overnight stay. No frills, no real luxuries but plain, simple, reasonably priced overnight accommodation. Thank you Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and a good price”
Reviews.Author: bcliles13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here in late December 2011 and stayed only one night. We flew in and rented a car and were slightly frustrated that the address given did not provide us to the door of the hotel when entered it into our GPS. However, when we called front desk, they provided us quick and easy directions and were there in a few minutes. It is close to the airport, however we did not experience any overhead airplane traffic noise. The place was nice and clean; bed was comfortable and plenty of parking available. I would recommend for a nice, comfortable stay in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, nice employees, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kristin S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. It was close to the airport, shopping and downtown Phoenix. The rooms were nice, a little small but overall we were happy. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 2 week trip”
Reviews.Author: scmexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we took a 2 week cruise to South America. It worked perfectly for us with the parking options that are available. Since we were gone during the Christmas holidays the parking had to be reserved. The hotel was convenient, good shuttle service, clean and friendly. The parking was about the same as other off site parking options. It did make it a lot easier since it you just got up in the morning and went directly to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: denise f
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable. The services have always been excellent. I've stayed at this facility numerous times and will continue to do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Airport - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: R0n_O
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 12/28/11. The location was chosen because it is close to Phoenix Sky Harbor airport and offers free 24 hour shuttle service to the airport. The rooms are clean and quiet. The heating and air conditioning worked great and was also quiet. The shuttle service to the airport was quick (less than 5 minutes) and picked my family up on time. We ate in the hotel restaurant for dinner and the food was excellent. The staff were friendly. We purchased this reservation on Priceline Name Your Price and saved $30.00. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Great location, confortable beds and great service. Shuttle Bus a little unorganized but great perk for the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “So easy to airport”
Reviews.Author: jwcorbet
Reviews.Content: Great location! 5 min. to airport using thier van. I park there when the both of us are traveling and leave the car up to 14 days with the stay and park program for free. Also when I fly out early in the a.m. we stay there and avoid the the traffic across towm. Not fancy but good food. Not over 1 yr old and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Check”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: We are retired; had a necessary visit with relatives; needed overnight stay nearby; brother made reservations; diappointed in the HI&S .. extremely noisey from highway and air traffic, room was cold, hair dryer had hair on it; mirror was dirty; pillows inadequate. Way too much cost (134) for what we received. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service I've had a in while”
Reviews.Author: adz55
Reviews.Content: My family and I were returning from a vacation overseas when our evening flight was cancelled out of PHX. So at 11pm we had to find a hotel. We had been traveling over 24 hours straight so we were tired and grumpy. The airline tried to send us to some crappy place but I'm a Priority Club member so I decided to go with what I know and call the Holiday Inn on the airport courtesy phone. Thankfully the Holiday Inn was running a shuttle service and so we hitched a ride. The hotel is much closer to the airport than I imagined, which is convenient. We were able to get booked into a room with no reservation. The man at the counter was very helpful and even scrounged up a baby bed for us and because our flight had been canceled he helped us with a discounted rate and included breakfast which took away some of the sting of not being home after a long day. The room was nice and clean, and comfortable with a large shower. The next morning the people working the restaurant area were very friendly and helpful, and the shuttle driver came and loaded up our luggage while we ate. All in all it was a pleasant end to a long traveling day. It seems like service like this is becoming harder to find. I was impressed enough that I told myself that I'd better make sure to write a review when I got home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lesmarjorie F
Reviews.Content: Friendly, attentive, clean and the restaurant and bar folks were great. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Stopover For Sky Harbor Airport”
Reviews.Author: Spudislander
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to the airport and car rental return. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful advising me how to return rental the evening of our hotel stay and access free shuttle back to hotel. The following morning the shuttle was prompt delivering us to the airport in lots of time to check in for our flight. The complimentary breakfast was typical but of good quality. Overall, the facility was very nice and the room was nice and clean in every respect. If the need ever arises, we would definitely use this again as an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never been disappointed by a Holiday Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: NCroadtripping
Reviews.Content: The last night of our vacation we needed a room near the airport in Phoenix. Holiday Inn...perfect!! Staff - professional and friendly. Service - love the 24-hr shuttle from the airport after dropping off our rental car and back the next morning for our flight. Lounge serving complete menu - welcome after a long day of driving. Room - big and classy. Bed - fabulously comfortable and again welcome after a long day of driving. Checkout - easy! Expectations - always exceeded! Thanks Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: wolverine87144
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting the great city of Phoenix, and need to stay near the airport, this place is among the best. It's also within a short drive to many fine restaurants. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the local area and go out of their way to make you feel welcome and comfortable. The Soleil lounge is a relaxing place to enjoy a complimentary beverage upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great!”
Reviews.Author: ThreeStarAdventure
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here again and once again had a great time. We spent a little more time in the bar and were happy with how we were taken care of, actually got to enjoy the pool, and had a better customer service experience than last time here. We are big fans of the sales manager, Rolando. He has taken very good care of us and had ensured that we will stay here every time we're back in Phoenix. Even the breakfast staff was better! Enjoyed our stay, and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very new and clean with a wonderful sit down breakfast”
Reviews.Author: teachermama1
Reviews.Content: I love new hotels. They are always so clean and stylish. We stayed here the night before we flew back home to Ohio, after a 2 week vacation that had started in Seattle. The beds were SO soft, along with the pillows. It was incredible. My kids went swimming in their outdoor pool, which was small, but fun for the kids and hubby. The breakfast was really nice. It was free with our ticket that the front desk gave us when we checked in. We went through the "buffet" and then had a really nice booth table to sit at in their restaurant. The food was good, including fruit and yogurt parfaits, fruit, meats, cereals, muffins, etc. The waitress got our drinks for us. So, you have to leave a tip. The only complaint I had with this hotel, was that there wasn't any recycling. The entire 2 weeks we were able to find recycling bins everywhere, until we hit this hotel. I was DEVESTATED to have to throw away plastic water bottles (we did not bring our reusable bottles on the plane)!!!!!!!!! I hope the management adds recycling, I told him about it. They had a free shuttle to the airport, but our flight didn't leave until 1:00 pm so we returned our rental car then took their free shuttle to the airport. DEFINITELY stay at this new hotel. The guy at the front desk was so friendly to our family and seemed amused by my family -still "speaking to one another" after 2 weeks together, including G'ma and G'pa!

Reviews.Title: “Great when we finally found it!”
Reviews.Author: Coyote88
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here before catching an early flight out of Phoenix Sky Harbour to Washington DC. The minor problem we ran into was finding the hotel. S. 48th Street is not where you might expect it to be. It is south off E. University Drive just west of the 143. Once we had given up and phoned the hotel reception they were very helpful in guiding us in. The room was big and comfortable and because of our late arrival and early start we ate our evening meal in the hotel restaurant which was good food and excellent value. The drive to the car rental return was 10 minutes and well signposted.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jwcorbet
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel when flying to Central & South America. Staff and rooms are very nice and it's close to the airport. We live 31 miles avay and the flights are early morning. So I get to sleep in and get to the airport with no problems. I have the top level on the Holiday Inn program so I get free drink and breakfast cupons and a room upgrade every time. This is the best Holiday Inn I have stayed in and I have stayed in a lot of them.

Reviews.Title: “Not like any Holiday Inn I've been in”
Reviews.Author: PoleyDoodle
Reviews.Content: I booked this last night last minute via Priceline (while i was on my flight.) I arrived around almost 11pm. The shuttle picked up right away after i called. They were ready for my arrival so i was able to get right up to my room. It was large and very clean with big screen TV. The free wifi is extremely fast (3x faster then my home internet). The bed was comfortable and i fell asleep right away. Unfortunately it was a very short trip and had to catch the 410am shuttle back to the airport so i cant comment on what daytime is like

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust0ne
Reviews.Content: I agree that this hotel is a bit hard to find (with the 48th St. issue) but otherwise, everything was great. We got a good book-ahead fare, which was honored again two other non-consecutive nights when we had to stay an extra night (due to flight cancellations) and then returned again the last night of our unexpectedly lengthened trip for an early morning next-day flight. The cool rooms and lovely pool were a wonderful respite from the August heat, and the staff was very cordial and accommodating at a time when we were stressed due to hurricane flight cancellations. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms clean. Even though we were only intending to stay there one night, we were happy to be there for three total, and part of our vacation includes happy memories of our time at the hotel and pool (good music at pool too!) Very close to airport and shuttle service very accommodating also. Internet (2 computers off of lobby) availability was quite helpful during flight issues. If our travels take us back to Phoenix (and we need a place to stay near the airport) we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find - but worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: doctall41
Reviews.Content: Using the Hertz Neverlost, I had to call the hotel to find them. The clerk said that happens all the time. Apparently, there are two S. 48th streets. Once there, the dinner was good, the room very nice. great lobby, smells new.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: I wasn't actually travelling for pleasure to this particular location. I got stuck in San Francisco and was re-routed to Phoenix to catch the first flight home to Norfolk. I called the emergency accommodation number (on a pink ticket from Southwest) and the first hotel on the list was this one. 5 minutes from the airport, 24/7 shuttle. Sold. I had no idea what to expect - I just wanted a place to sleep. To my surprise/amazement, this place is beautiful. Brand new, great lobby, warm and helpful staff (Justin the night desk clerk was most accommodating) and a beautiful, clean, quiet room. I could not have asked for more. I got an exceptional AAA rate, too. My 4:15 am wake-up call was on time and the shuttle driver was waiting for me when I went downstairs to catch my 6:55 am flight home. Really, I could not have asked for a better experience. Given the circumstances, and how crappy Southwest had treated me that day, I was well relieved to stay at such a nice place for so little effort and money. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bogiboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in August. I found everything about this hotel to be fine. Helpful staff, good clean rooms, WiFi and a hearty breakfast buffet. Yes, it's out of the city but you need a car to get around Phoenix anyway. From here, you can drive downtown or to the major shopping malls easily. I will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ann194
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites Phoenix Airport on 48th street. The room was very clean, staff was exceptionally friendly. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. My husband used the free internet and had no problem connecting and staying connected.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christina S
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. New, clean, spacious rooms, close to the airport. My biggest concern was bed bugs, but rest assured there are NONE here. Clean as could be! I was thrilled! The breakfast was delicious and the staff was excellent. Will be back again. Stayed here three nights!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: mark_conrad
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable. I turned on air-con for a while and it cooled quickly and was fairly quiet. Coffee machine didn't seem to work, but that could have been me. Overall things were very modern and clean. If you like to use stairs rather than the elevator, you cannot in this hotel, as they are alarmed. One of those American touches ! Shuttle service to and from airport was quick and courteous. Had one meal in he restaurant on arrival and would give it 8/10 for service and 7/10 for food. There's a small bar too. Pool was closed when I visited, but it was just after the big dust storm. Went to this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and found it was OK but couldn't understand the rave reviews unless other hotels in Phoenix are lousy. Tried to make an internet booking before my flight to phoenix but could not connect so I asked hotel to honour the rate I found. They wouldn't so I paid $102 on first night - got it down to $85 on next night with Orbitz. Staff were quite helpful and pleasant, but I don't think they communicate with each other when they change shifts as much confusion about having booked second night on internet. If I needed to stopover in Phoenix again, I'd be happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: HotelRockmiser
Reviews.Content: So, recently I found myself returning to Phoenix on a business trip and chose this hotel ---not because of how close it was to a Dunkin Donuts--- alright, that was the reason I chose this hotel. It's a little out of the way from everything Phoenix, which I liked, don't get me wrong. I used to live there and didn't like it much, but here, it was a breath of fresh air. First thing's first. It was under a hundred dollars, the room.... WOW!!!! JUST FRIGGIN WOW! The size of this room is was bigger than my one bedroom apartment when I lived there. Both the bedroom and the living room had big 42 inch flat screen tvs. The bathroom was large, the room was clean, everything about this hotel rool was great! There's also a restaurant built near the lobby that I didn't partake in (see Dunkin Donuts comment earlier). They give you a free ticket for a drink and breakfast, which is awesome. All in all, the front and center point to this review and this hotel is this: I will certainly stay here again, I love it here and I hope that anyone who happens to be in Phoenix checks it out. ...and get some Dunkin Donuts (There's none in California where I live, what do you want from me?)

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tom2121
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just perfect. Friendly staff and brand new. The wifi is the best I have ever had in a U.S. hotel. The restaurant is ok, but not sooo good. Best value ever. Not near the center but if you just want to have a rest before going to the Grand Canyon, this is the place. There's a hot tub but it's so warm out there..the pool is not very refreshing but it's ok. Does the job.

Reviews.Title: “This Holiday Inn is part of the 21st Century!”
Reviews.Author: DanCohen55
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night so I could make a morning flight at Sky Harbor. This new (1 year old) hotel is like no other Holiday Inn I've stayed at. Ultra-modern, pillow-top bed, fresh color scheme, great amenities, a very nice bar/restaurant with an inventive menu. Really enjoyed this stay and wish I had spent the earlier part of the week in a Holiday Inn this nice!! One con: The exercise room...sub-par equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best...”
Reviews.Author: scottyth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if you need to be close to the airport, or ASU. It has a very modern feel, quite different from most holiday inns I've been in. The rooms are very comfortable, the bar is awesome ( Belinda is the best!) the food is very good ( I suggest the chicken and risotto) and the internet is fast, reliable, and free. Stayed in room 314 on 7/27, checked out on 7/28. I ALWAYS stay at this hotel when in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY IN THE SUMMER”
Reviews.Author: sunlovingOregon
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in the summer because the staff does not turn on the air-conditioner before someone arrives. Ours ran for 8 hrs straight. We left early in the morning for the airpor to get away from it's noise. Only eat in the restaurant if you want bad service with so, so food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for any business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: 10Newlywed10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business. Location was ideal. Very clean. Customer service was great. Full service. New build. Price was fantastic. Would stay here any time I am in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...New, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BSouliere
Reviews.Content: Excellent new hotel. 5-10 minute drive from the airport car rental center. Front desk was very nice. Very helpful, printed maps for us and made recommendations. The rooms are very clean and quiet. Nice flat screen tv and big fluffy pillows. The price was right at under 90.00. I highly recommend staying and would stay again next time in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maggie'sGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new property and you can tell they have been listening to customers as this one has nice spaces in the public areas, restaurant with decent food, open all hours. Rooms are comfortable with more than adequate lighting. I think internet was free but we did not use except to print boarding passes. Staff was knowledgable about local food, gas, airport information. Very convenient to airport which is why we booked. We were able to return our rental car, check in at the gate and be ready for our flight in good time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantacular!”
Reviews.Author: Sp00nHead
Reviews.Content: In Phoenix for the first time and chose this hotel because of location close to the airport. Staff was FANTASTIC - they helped plan my adventures and provided maps to help me find my way. Room was clean and spacious with all the amenities, including a microwave and refrigerator. Restaurant was good as well. I would highly recommend this hotel and its entire staff to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The bar has been raised...”
Reviews.Author: Rice_Krispies
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in February, due to an early flight out of PHX airport the following morning. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport adjacent to the freeway in a corporate park area. It is away from the flight path, so no noise from airplanes flying overhead. The hotel is brand new, and was probably built within the last year. It has the new design theme of Holiday Inn and will blow away all of your past connotations of the shabby Holiday Inns of the 1980s. The design of the hotel exterior, lobby and rooms is sleek and modern. The front desk is more like a kiosk....it's a smaller hotel, so it works. The rooms have an upscale look reminiscent of Westin and Wyndham. Even the bathrooms have granite counters and large, stone tiled bath areas. My only complaint about the sleeping rooms, was that it does not come with an in-room safe. All of the other essential amenities are there - wi-fi, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron and iron board and hair dryer. Other reviewers have complained about the restaurant, and quite frankly, it is small. It can maybe seat 50 guests (there is a small buffet area during breakfast in the rear), so if there is a group staying at the hotel, it can easily get too busy there. My suggestion is to avoid staying at this hotel if there is a group of more than 15 rooms staying there....the property is just not designed to handle groups. Otherwise, the hotel really is beautiful, and I hope all Holidays Inns around the country are going for this new look. It really erases the "cheap" image of Holiday Inns of years past, and puts the brand one step above others.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience / staff went out of their way”
Reviews.Author: mcj_daniels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 2 separate occasions in May. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Beautiful new facility; clean; lovely restaurant / lounge, business centre; close to airport; they gave complimentary drink coupons on arrival - I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: giantroadrider
Reviews.Content: Waited over 90 minutes for hotel shuttle making numerous calls to staff. Staff was rude, disrespectful and snotty. Management was indifferent to address the problem the next day. No adult supervision (management) during off hours. This hotel, located in close proximity to Sky Harbor is new, but with all of the other choices right in the same area - this one should be avoided. Why spend good money to be treated poorly when you can spend the same money and be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “rs.”
Reviews.Author: bropera
Reviews.Content: A lot of thought and research was done to design this handicap room. We always need room for an electric wheelchair and shower chair without having to move furniture and equipment, this room was huge . We also need two beds, since the disabled person is often traveling with a caregiver that is not related or has a family with a child. This room had two queen size beds and lots of room. The roll in shower had two shower heads with one being removable. the bathroom counter was the right height for a shower chair to slide under. We were provided with plenty of towels, as this was always a problem with other hotels. The room was elegant, the staff was helpful and asked if there was anything we needed to make our stay more comfortable. (The beds were very comfortable.)

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice, room was great, roof noise was BAD”
Reviews.Author: AnnW_pdx
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed that no other review has mentioned this. Maybe we just had the only room affected by this. We were on the top floor. Great, right? No one above us. Wrong! I can only guess that the HVAC system for the hotel was right above our heads. Something mechanical sure was. It cycled on and off literally every 30 seconds from 11:00 to past midnight on our first night. Constant hum, fine, but rumble on and off, on and off: impossible to sleep. And it was loud, whatever it was. I'm a wimp, so I didn't complain, but it sucked. Second night it happened again, although only for about 45 minutes. Anyway, the rest of our stay was fine- the shuttle was great and took us to the lightrail a couple of times. The staff was nice, the location worked well for the airport, and we had a fabulous stay in Phoenix overall. But beware if you're placed on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Priority Club members....stay here!”
Reviews.Author: badsherry
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this location and it did not disappoint. Even though my meetings were downtown, I choose to stay here again, due to the friendliness of the staff, quality of service and cleanliness. Dan checked me in, he was very polite and professional. I am a Priority Club Platinum member, and this Holiday Inn does give some nice perks. I was given a suite upgrade, free drink coupon for each night, and free breakfast coupon for each morning (keep in mind, this is only if you are a member, I don't want anyone to be mad they didn't get it if they don't belong to Priority Club). Dan also gave me directions to where I had to go downtown in such a way that I could avoid the rush hour traffic, which was greatly appreciated. He took the time to enter the address into Google and get my directions. Nice lobby area and a business center with 2 computers. I was informed and apologized to right away that the printers were out of toner, it happens people! Stuff does take time to order...My suite was on the 3rd floor, and was huge! There is a living room area with a loveseat, chair, coffee table, flat screen LG television, desk area, sink, refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. A hallway takes you down to the bathroom and bedroom. This one had a king bed (which was very comfortable, I love having a "pillow menu" that you can order other types of pillows if you wish), large desk, ergonomic chair, and another LG television. The entire room was very clean, with no bed bugs found! (I check when I stay in hotels). I liked the fact that there is a second door to the bedroom which locks. Bath and Body Works toiletries in the bathroom. There is a small bar, with a fireplace and several tv's to watch. Great, attentive service. I ate in the bar, which has the same menu as the restaurant. The breakfast buffet that was included had plenty of choices. Yes, it is the same food, but you can get what you want. Hot items (scrambeled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes), breads, pastries, fruit, yougurt, boiled eggs, cereal. I thought it was a nice selection. I had one wake up call when I was there, and it was right on time. All the staff that I encountered here were friendly and helpful. Yes, it is located near the airport and the highway, but during the nighttime while sleeping, I did not hear any noise. Although, I do sleep with the fan running constantly, so I'm really not sure if noise is an issue. They do provide an airport shuttle. Parking is free, and internet is included. I will definitely stay here again, and would not hesitate to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A great way to end a vacation”
Reviews.Author: riverdoc2
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room near the airport, spacious with nice outdoor jacuzzi. We appreciated the free shuttle - helped save us money on the car rental - could return early. They were very accomodating

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: banan034
Reviews.Content: Hotel new & clean as stated, but very noisy--next to freeway, breakfast set-up very difficult to use & same food every day-not all rooms come with breakfast, clerks do not address issues, simply brush you off. Printer out of toner for 3 days at least.

Reviews.Title: “I love it when a hotel does what it says it does”
Reviews.Author: Cantstandbadhotels
Reviews.Content: It's an airport hotel, yes. It's a tourist class hotel, probably. But it does everything right. We parked easily, checked in fast, room was clean with free wi fi, no surprises, cozy. We were hungry and it was late, so we went to the small restaurant in the lobby. We had low expectations but were we ever pleasantly surprised. The booth had its own TV, our waitress was charming, and the food was great (pasta and quesadilla both better than some restaurants with high ratings). Newspaper at our door in the morning, buffet breakfast again in the restaurant. I was really impressed and we've stayed at a wide range of hotels from $50/night to $1000/night. Tough to impress me, but I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: DD12361
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff is very cordial and professional. It is apparent they aim to make your experience a great one. I am a priority club member and I travel quite a bit, as a result, I am no stranger to hotel stays. When I am in the area on business I choose to stay at this hotel. Why, because each time I arrive, starting with Andrea and her front desk staff, they make you feel welcome, and throughout my stay, the hotel staff continues to work towards making your stay a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean, comfortable...even cozy”
Reviews.Author: 52024Carol
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, bed and pillows so comfortable. A nice little restaurant and lounge on site so there was no need to drive any farther after a long day of traveling!! Nice dinner with a glass of wine. Desk clerk provided a map with clear easy to follow directions to car rental return the next morning. Would definitely return! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Murphy1110
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. Rooms were very nice. I needed a taxi and they provided a list of recommended services. Free wifi throughout the hotel. Location is good to airport but there isn't anything to walk to from the hotel, so you either need the shuttle if it is close, or you need to get a taxi or car service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: csands33
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, clean and spacious room to stay in for one day and night before flying out the next morning. This was a PERFECT selection. The price was great. The room was spacious. There were four of us (2 adults and 2 children) and we were not on top of each other. My 10 month old was able to safely explore the room and crawl on the floor....cleanliness is a HUGE issue with him constantly on the floor and this hotel exceeded my expectations in that area. The location was perfect for meeting friends about 20 mins away and for a very quick trip to the airport the next morning. The staff were friendly and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we visit in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay at near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: subwaymark
Reviews.Content: My employer had me review this hotel against another nearby hotel last Summer. I have since stayed at this hotel at least 6 different times becasue I perfer it to the other hotel. The room a fresh and comfortable. The staff is friendly and pleansant. My only negative comment was once I got it late around 2am, but nobody was at the front desk with not notes. It took about 15 minutes before the clerk showed up. He was apparently tracking down some pens. The resturant is nice, and the wait staff is fantastic. I particularly enjoye the service provided by Nicole during a stay I had in December. the food was also above average. Sadly my return visit in January the food was just average for the same order. But still better then some places. The rooms are nice and clean. I like the choice of pillows. Lighting is okay. Still seems dim to me, but I rarely find a hotel with the amount of lighting I like. The light switches at the door to the room are a bit confusing. One kills ALL the lights in the room, the other switch just the general light for the room. Be careful if you plug chargers into the lamp socket, and turn off the main switch your items won't charge. Overall I really like this hotel it is very convenient to the freeways and the airport. There is nothing really close to the hotel, so a car is virtually necessary to get to some places to eat. But Downtown Tempe is a short drive with many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday for business”
Reviews.Author: meli5
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that is very close to the airport beside the noise my staying was good. They're very helpful given me the so needed information when I had to stay for a conference meeting of our company.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sisi123
Reviews.Content: The excellent service started when I called the hotel directly and spoke to Andrea. I needed to be there for 5 nights and because of the big football game in town they could only book me for 2. Andrea gave me a lot of helpful info and suggested I call back and when I did Dana was there to help me complete my stay there. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff was there to help. I happen to like the location because I wasn't sure where I would be and I was near the highways. I took advatage of having free internet service. My only problem was at breakfast the day all the football folks were there. The dining room staff was a little overwhelmed and my order for breakfast never appeared...but they apoplogized and took care of it. If returning to the Phoenix area I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy camper”
Reviews.Author: not_a_fan_11
Reviews.Content: I got stuck with a non cancelable "special" rate for the national championship. i tried to cancel and move to the Holiday Inn Express where family and friends were staying. The hotel staff and manager, Dana refused to allow a cancelation even with a penalty. I paid more ($50) but got lesser accomodations than the Holdiay Inn Express, less than 3 miles away. The extra insult was the breakfast buffet that I had to pay for while the express was free and better. The fitness center was small and unusable for more than 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've had”
Reviews.Author: wcombs65
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We were in town from Oklahoma for the 2011 Fiesta Bowl. It was very clean and the service was excellent. HD tvs in the rooms. We even got a chance to meet with the owner and he wanted to make sure our stay was a good experience. The best thing about this hotel is the quality for the price. Our room was a great deal and for the price it was better than we could have expected. Everything was top notch, from the linens to the shower to the bar. I will stay here every time I am in Phoenix from now on. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience ruined by shuttle”
Reviews.Author: RunFar
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews that I read. The hotel is a great place to stay to catch a plane out of the Phoenix airport. The room we stayed in was comfortable, quiet and clean. Daniel at the front desk was so helpful in directions to a restaurant and making arrangements for shuttle service. The shuttle to the airport was waiting when we came down to the lobby and everything went smoothly. Our return wasn't as pleasant. I called the hotel after getting our luggage at 1:00am. We were told the shuttle would be right there. (It's 5 minutes away at the most) After waiting 20 minutes in the cold and rain I called again. I was told the driver had been contacted. I called again after waiting 30 minutes and finally the driver pulled up. Another guest waiting had also called a number of times. The driver gave us the excuse that he had just come on duty, but when I asked the other driver's name he changed the subject. When we reached the hotel the driver pulled up at the front door and I explained that we were in the back parking lot and would appreciate it if he took us around back, which he did. Our car wouldn't start and we had to call AAA. Justin at the desk was most empathetic, offered us something warm to drink and kept watching for AAA. The staff is great (including the reservation clerk) but the shuttle experience was enough to make me look inot a different hotel for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MissCF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days and it was absolutely wonderful. The only complaint I have is with regards to the shuttle service. A couple of times, the shuttle was not available, because the front desk thought it was cancelled, another time it wasn't going to be able and we found out last minute, and the final inconvenience was when the front desk gave a ETA time of 10- 15 minutes when it was actually 45 minutes. Other than that, it was a great experience. Nice and Clean!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: wolverine87144
Reviews.Content: From check-in, and throughout the stay, a beautiful experience. The room layout is superb and spacious. The built-in desk area could be a bit more spacious, but the sitting area, with a chair and a pull-out queen sofa sleeper, is roomy and well lit. The separate sleeping area, with an additional 37" flat screen TV, is nearly as large as entire rooms in other hotels. From the east side of the hotel, there's a view of mountains, albeit accross the interstate. Lounge and restaurant are nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: troyfields
Reviews.Content: We stayed here first because it was close to the airport and we were not familiar with Phoenix. We found that this is a new facility and very modern. The staff starting with Andrea, Tori and Dan at the front desk were very friendly and willing to help us find things that we wanted to see. They even printed out the directions to the places we wanted to go. We stayed at another Holiday Inn where the breakfast were included, but we preferred to pay the $10 for breakfast in this Inn than the free breakfast in the other Inn. If the same staff is here when you visit, it will be great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine until I lost my brand new Citizen watch”
Reviews.Author: Carol1024
Reviews.Content: When walked into the hotel in the evening, I was very impressed - clean and quiet, friendly staff. I would've give the hotel a good score if this never happened - I forgot my brand new Citizen watch on the countertop of the rest room when checking out. Two hours later, when I recognized it and drove back to the hotel, the room was cleaned and the watch was gone!!! No hotel manager on duty on that day to investigage. I left contact information on the case report, but they didn't even try to call me back until I called the interim manager the next day afternoon. My watch was gone foreever. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TA1Phoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: Great room , very helpful front desk staff. Everything was right, The gym is on the sparse side, however.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Redland
Reviews.Content: Someone at this hotel has figured it out. A great hotel that has an incredible staff. No need to leave as the food is as good or better than you will find in 99% of the restaurant in the Phoenix area. Breakfast, lunch, hot appitizers at happy hour and dinner are all amazing. I never have to drive out to a restaurant an get the usual "just one" question and these people make you feel at home. The evening bar maids are amazing to say the least. Belinda and Nicole give every person in the place great service and make you feel like a special customer. They really make an effort to see that you get what you need and are friendly to all. These people are going to keep this hotel filled and the bar and restaurant busy strictly due to the service and attitudes. Who ever is running the kitchen is extremely good at what they do - this is not you average hotel food to say the least. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Road Warrior Experience”
Reviews.Author: soddycreek
Reviews.Content: Recently on a overnight to Phoenix, I was pleasantly suprised on the accomodations, personnel, food and in general the hotel overall... when checking in the staff me an upgrade and told me what game was on TV and channel and the special at the restaurant. Really a nice change from the hum drum on being a road warrior. Price was a little high but very close to airport and transportation. Be back again...you bet...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one night stay”
Reviews.Author: javabeach
Reviews.Content: We recently drove into Phoenix after a week at the Grand Canyon and Sedona for an early flight out the next morning. We stayed at the Holiday Inn on 48th St. This was perfect. Close to the airport, yet quiet enough for a good night's sleep. This place is brand new, opened in April. Dan at the front desk was great, a 5-star host, quite helpful with directions and dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, but very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: CactusLover
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the pool was sparkling, and the employees were all helpful. The bed was firm, with plenty of pillow options, as will as cover options. Plus, there was a super large screen TV, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, and plenty of storage.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: boodaddyx3
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick & efficient. Staff extremely friendly & accomodating. Heather in the restaurant has an unbelievable attitude. Very friendly young lady. Great hotel, restaurant & staff. Will stay here again on return trips to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ruby22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on TA reviews and have to agree with the positive things others have said. The location is excellent, only 5-7 minutes from the airport and the shuttle service was right on time. Only stayed one night but would most definitely return. The Hotel is new, the rooms are spotless, nicely furnished, very comfortable beds, and the staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: NCMaynard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! I felt like I was wrapped in luxury from the moment I walked in the front door. The staff are all friendly and polite. They took the time to use my name whenever they talked to me, in person or on the phone. After I checked in they called my room to make sure everything was alright. The room was splendid. It was comfortable and luxurious. The materials and colors they use made me think I was in a condo instead of a hotel. The placement of a flatscreen TV in the living area as well as one in the bedroom was a welcome comfort. The tilework in the bathroom was gorgeous. Mostly I appreciate the fact the the climate control is not a wall unit stuck under the window. There is actually a thermostat on the wall which controls a central air unit for the suite. I definitely plan to stay there every time I am in Phoenix. Great work!

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: sstone67
Reviews.Content: Only stayed overnight to get to the airport but the service was great. Front desk clerk and shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful. The room was fine and the bed was comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownsara123
Reviews.Content: The weather was unbearably hot BUT the hotel made our stay extremely comfortable. The Holiday Inn at Phoenix airport is a new, modern hotel. We were welcomed by excellent staff as soon as we walked in and that did not end there, it went from courteous staff at check-in to breakfast and all the way to check-out. The maids were a little off, but that was the least of our concerns. The only reason I say that is because of the way the beds were being made. Otherwise the rooms and reception area and restaurant were spotless and well maintained. We loved the wine lounge where we were able to mingle with other guests and make new acquaintances. Overall I would like to give management a "thumbs-up" on a job being well done. Look forward to my next stay at Phoenix airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great value”
Reviews.Author: hkshishcisjhc
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel very near Phoenix Airport with a restaurant, for an early morning flight. Pre-paid, the room cost just under $80.It had two queen sized beds, a micro wave, coffee maker, a fridge and was air conditioned. It offered both synthetic firm and soft pillows or down filled pillows if requested. (synthetic pillows had a removable band attached) The room was spacious and modern.The hotel had a free shuttle service and collected us from the car return area at Phoenix airport on the afternoon of our arrival and returned us to the airport at 4 a.m. the following morning. We were very warmly greeted on our arrival at the hotel. Within 20 minutes of arrival in the room we received a call from reception enquiring if everything in the room was o.k. The restaurant had a reasonable if narrow range of choices but was reasonably priced and the food was tasty. Again here the service was excellent and very friendly. When we went to reception to place our shuttle request for the following morning we asked about a vending machine to purchase water. We received a free bottle of water each. We received a wake up call as requested at 3:30 a.m. and the shuttle bus arrived promptly at 4 a.m. to take us to the airport. We spent three weeks in varying hotels in the South West of the States in August and we can honestly say that the service we received at the Holiday Inn, Phoenix Airport was better than all the other hotels we stayed in which were considerably dearer. Eithne, Dublin, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Safe Location, Great Price & Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChiMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a layover, was a little concerned about the area when I booked (especially given the inexpensive rate) but it is a nice business area close to the airport. Shuttle was fast/efficient as was check-in. Everything is new and very nice, closer to a Hyatt/Hilton experience with decor. Staff was great, food and drink was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again.....”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: Okay, it is a relatively new hotel. Yes it is pretty and clean. That's all the good i can say about it. My work computer could not reach my office computer since the hotel blocked it somehow. This is the only hotel ever that I have had this problem. Yes, I got the internet but they have so many firewalls up that I could not contact my office from my room internet. So, I had to use the Office Center here at the hotel. There was no air conditioning in this tiny room and it was 115 degrees outside while I was there. The Office Center was like a sauna and I complained and it never got fixed the whole time I was there. They also have loud music playing through thoughout the hotel that is so loud in the Office Center that you could not concentrate on your work. No one knew how to turn it off except the Hotel Manager who only did it for a few minutes since I complained. The thermostat in my room would work sometimes then sometimes not. Again, it was 115 degrees the week I was there. You either were too hot or too cold. Also, sometimes the lights in my room and the electrical sockets would work sometimes and sometimes not. It was like my room was haunted. Also, no trash cans outside the doors of the hotel to throw stuff away as you come in from your car and no trash cans in the lobby. I almost felt like just piling it up by the outside door but I would never do such a thing. Most of the front desk staff were extremely nice but very unknowable as to fixing the problems I had. Some said they would contact maintenance but the issues never got fixed during my stay. So, as nice at the hotel looked, they won't get another penny from me again. See ya.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: pickyNEgirl
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat of a neat freak and am picky about hotels. That said, here is my review: Front Desk: very nice staff; aim to please; professional; service with a smile Housekeeping: excellent; very clean - no complaints; responds quickly to requests 2 Queen Bed Rooms: a little cramped for 4 people (2 adults/2children) - no room to open all 4 suitcases at the same time unless you put a couple of them on the bed; bathroom and fan both come on when you flip the switch on, (women beware, because it can be cold showering in the winter time causing goosebumps on cleanly shaven legs); someone mentioned this same problem because there is only a small light on the bathroom blow-dryer for a nightlight, however, we used the blow-dryer light and slightly cracked open the room darkening shades for a nightlight, and it worked well; the room had a mini-fridge, blow-dryer, iron. Sleep Quality: beds & pillows very comfortable; beds are firm but have a cushion top or fluffy mattress pad and are very comfortable for sleepers in any position; pillows come in firm or soft, but if you prefers a different thickness of pillow call the front desk as they have different pillows available. This hotel is very close to the airport, but is very quiet; we did not hear planes unless we were out in the pool. The only noise we heard was the quiet hum when the elevator went up and down, but we were in room 203 which has the elevator on one side of it and another hotel room on the other side - however, the hum didn't wake us up when we were sleeping, and both my son and I are light sleepers. Value: hotel was a great value; breakfast buffet (fresh juices included) a little pricey ($9.95 at the time) but was worth it, and our kids ate free, so it was about $5 pp. Our server was very nice and willing to assist; food was delicious; cook offered to make additional waffles for us. Location: Kinda hard to find. Easy with these directions. Coming from I-10, go North on Hwy 143. Exit University Drive. Left onto University Drive. Left onto 48th Street. The hotel offers a shuttle to the airport also. This hotel is only 2 months old, and we were very pleased and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It Even Smells New...”
Reviews.Author: erune
Reviews.Content: Four and a half stars...We stayed here on an overnight layover on our way home from the D.C. area. This hotel is very close to the airport and they have a 24-hour shuttle that runs every 30 minutes. There is a restaurant and bar in the lobby and they gave us a coupon for a free drink in the bar. We didn't use it, but I'm sure if we had more time we would have. The rooms are new and equipped with more than enough pillows. My husband much preferred this hotel as compared to another all-suite hotel in the area with a comparable price. The only downfall for me was that with little kids, we usually leave a bathroom light on as a nightlight but the bathroom light and bathroom fan are on the same switch. That meant that we had to run the bathroom fan all night long. Otherwise, we really liked the convenience factor and great customer service here...more than adequate for an overnight layover that provides a free shuttle at all hours and is close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, new branding works well”
Reviews.Author: Spiderpig41
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Friday night before setting off on a Roadtrip. I needed a place to crash after 18 hours of travel. The shuttle was prompt and the drivers I had were helpful and friendly. Reception was most helpful and the bar staff receptive and attentive. The rooms were what to be expected of a new hotel. I was given a two room suite with kitchenette, two large LG HD TV's, good coffee facilities and a good sized bathroom. The bed was more than adequate and the decor quite relaxing. The shower had great water pressure which as I found later is unusual in some parts of Arizona. I was given a voucher for a drink and a complimentary breakfast which was well provided and set me up for the day after a swim in the pool and ten minutes in the whirlpool. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect new hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCoffey
Reviews.Content: The kind folks at the front desk told me this hotel has been open only a month. I stayed here in mid May for business one weeknight. I had room 201 and it was lovely. Corner room with wrap around windows, HUGE flat panel tv, desk and leather chair with ottoman. Lovely pool ( too late to use sadly) and furnishings so new, the hall smells a little of wallpaper paste :) You won't regret staying here either since its only a few blocks from the airport and the business parks along University Dr. No free breakfast like HIE's, but I believe gold level members get a coupon for drinks in the bar, and breakfast buffet.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Phoenix Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 3220 S. 48th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85040
